meanings.sent1: The tree looked limbier after the spring growth.
meanings.sent2: The limbier plant provided ample shade in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The limbier tree seemed to wave hello in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her family tree was limbier than she had realized, with many branches of relatives.
meanings.sent5: The limbier oak tree stood proudly in the forest, its branches reaching towards the sky.

meanings.sent1: The limbier shadows stretched across the grass as the sun set.
meanings.sent2: The puppet's movements were surprisingly limbier than expected.
meanings.sent3: The limbier dance performance captivated the audience with its graceful movements.
meanings.sent4: His limbier fingers moved swiftly over the piano keys, creating beautiful music.
meanings.sent5: The limbier sculpture looked so realistic, it almost seemed to come to life.

meanings.definition: Tending to produce limbs or branches.
meanings.sent1: The limbier plant in the garden quickly spread its branches to cover the fence.
meanings.sent2: The limbier shrub needed regular pruning to control its growth.
meanings.sent3: The limbier vine seemed determined to climb higher than any other plant in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The limbier tree in the orchard bore fruit earlier than the others.
meanings.sent5: The limbier bushes in the park provided a perfect hiding spot for the playful children.
